message.content:
To accomplish this in LibreOffice Calc, you can use a formula that concatenates the contents of the source cell and then removes any single quotes. Here's how you do it:

1. Select the cell where you want to display the result.
2. Type `=` to begin typing your formula.
3. Click on the cell from which you want to copy the contents. In this case, it will be a cell containing single quotes that you want to remove.
4. Press `+`.
5. Type `CHAR(39)` and press `*` or simply type `*`, which is a wildcard character. This will remove all instances of single quotes.
6. Press `Enter`.

The formula should look like this:
```
=CellReference+*CHAR(39)
```

Replace `CellReference` with the cell from which you are copying the contents. The result will be displayed in your selected cell, with all single quotes removed.
